K.definition: a round fruit that is red or green
a round object used in games
the star at the center of our solar system
the natural satellite of the Earth
a large plant with a trunk, branches, and leaves
a collection of written or printed pages bound together
a vehicle with wheels powered by an engine
an item worn on the head

1.definition: a person with whom one shares a bond of mutual affection
a clear, essential liquid for life
feeling or showing pleasure or contentment
an expression of happiness or amusement
a feathered animal that typically flies
the colorful bloom of a plant
a two-wheeled vehicle powered by pedaling

2.definition: a piece of ground where plants are grown
a large natural stream of water
a visible mass of condensed water vapor in the sky
a large natural elevation of the earth's surface
a vast area covered chiefly with trees
a sandy or pebbly shore by a body of water
the warmest season of the year
the coldest season of the year
a narrative, either true or fictional
the art of arranging sounds in a harmonious or expressive way

3.definition: ready to face and endure danger or pain
eager to learn or know something
to travel through an area to learn about it
an arc of colors visible in the sky after rain
an act of traveling from one place to another

4.definition: very old; from a long time ago
difficult or impossible to understand or explain
willing to give more of something than is strictly necessary or expected
achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort
showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties
sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention
careful to avoid potential problems or dangers
able to express ideas clearly and effectively

5.definition: to examine in detail for purposes of explanation and interpretation
to note the similarities between two or more things
to compare in order to show differences
to judge or determine the significance, worth, or quality of something
to explain or decorate a text, concept, or process with examples or pictures
to say what will happen in the future based on current evidence
to cause something to occur in a particular way; to decide or conclude
to give a brief statement of the main points
to show or prove to be right or reasonable

6.definition: a fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen
a proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence
an element, feature, or factor that is liable to change
a scientific procedure undertaken to make a discovery or test a hypothesis
a system of ideas intended to explain something
to show clearly by giving proof or evidence
to explain the meaning of information or actions
important enough to be noticed or have an effect
the available body of facts or information indicating whether a belief is true
a final decision or judgment reached after consideration

7.definition: open to more than one interpretation; unclear
possible to do easily or conveniently
of only average quality; not very good
able to recover quickly from difficulties or setbacks
performed or occurring as a result of a sudden impulse without premeditation
not or no longer needed or useful; superfluous
to examine or inspect closely and thoroughly
to clear someone of blame or suspicion

8.definition: a typical example or pattern of something
a confusing and difficult problem or question
a mild or indirect word substituted for one considered harsh or blunt
to make a problem or negative situation worse
famous or well known, typically for some bad quality or deed
to make something clear; to explain
dealing with things sensibly and realistically rather than theoretically

9.definition: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
lasting only for a short time; impermanent
based on observation or experience rather than theory
no longer produced or used; out of date
featuring new methods; advanced and original
skilled and competent in a particular field
acting independently or having the freedom to do so
to respond to a gesture or action with a similar one

10.definition: to render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible
to cease to resist an opponent or an unwelcome demand; surrender
tending to talk a great deal; talkative
lasting for a very short time
sweet or musical; pleasant to hear
severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance
kept secret, especially because it would not be approved of
to use ambiguous language so as to conceal the truth or avoid committing oneself
deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources
tending to keep a firm hold of something; persistent and determined

11.definition: a person or thing that is mysterious or difficult to understand
representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
carried out with minimal effort or reflection; routine and superficial
to spread or disperse something, especially information, widely
to make something better or improve a situation
having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority
using very few words; concise to the point of seeming rude or mysterious
characterized by vulgar or pretentious display; designed to impress or attract notice

12.definition: intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge
a natural or habitual inclination or tendency
using more words than are needed; wordy
a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds
